summary: The '287(g) Program Protection Act' aims to clarify and strengthen the 287(g) program within the Immigration and Nationality Act. It mandates that the Secretary of Homeland Security enter into agreements with states or political subdivisions, upon request, to allow local law enforcement to perform immigration functions. The bill clarifies approval processes, limits termination of agreements, and requires uniform training for participating officers. It further amends funding related to the program and establishes annual reporting requirements on performance and recruitment efforts.
